alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 7:13PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 800 PM MDT... At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Kit Carson, or 23 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview and Wild Horse. This includes Highway 385 near mile marker 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
